meanings.definition: To keep or set aside for future use
meanings.sent1: She is reserving some cookies for later.
meanings.sent2: I am reserving a seat for you at the party.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was reserving nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: He was reserving his energy for the final sprint.
meanings.sent5: By reserving water, we ensured we had enough for the whole hike.

meanings.sent1: They are reserving a table at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: We should consider reserving our tickets early.
meanings.sent3: She was reserving a spot in line by standing there.
meanings.sent4: Reserving a hotel room before the trip is wise.
meanings.sent5: Reserving a rental car ahead of time saved us money.

meanings.definition: To hold back or save for a particular purpose
meanings.sent1: He was reserving his strength for the final challenge.
meanings.sent2: The chef is reserving some sauce for garnishing.
meanings.sent3: The magician was reserving his best trick for last.
meanings.sent4: She was reserving her opinion until she had more information.
meanings.sent5: Reserving some funds for emergencies is always a good idea.
